playgame.res_text: Select a unit to deploy at your fortres

unit_info_default.name: NaN
unit_info_default.description: This doesnt seem to be a valid Unit

unit_info.name: Catapult
unit_info.description: A mighty unit that can capture two units per move

unit_info.name: Crossbowman
unit_info.description: A light Unit that moves one field in the diagonal

unit_info.name: Fort
unit_info.description: Houses the Reserves. Can be destroyed if two opposition units enter its adjacent squares

unit_info.name: Fort
unit_info.description: Houses the Reserves. Can be destroyed if two opposition units enter its adjacent squares

unit_info.name: Dragon
unit_info.description: Moves in any direction and can bypass mountains and water fields

unit_info.name: Elephant
unit_info.description: This powerfull creature can only be captured if another enemy piece is adjacent

unit_info.name: King
unit_info.description: Moves one field in any direction. If captured the game is lost

unit_info.name: Light Horse
unit_info.description: Moves in a straight line. Can move off the edge of the board and enter on the opposite site

unit_info.name: Mountain
unit_info.description: Will block almost all units moves

unit_info.name: Spearman
unit_info.description: Moves one field in a straight line. Can change postion with friendly units

unit_info.name: Trebuchet
unit_info.description: Moves in a straight line. May bypass friendlys to capture

unit_info.name: Rabble
unit_info.description: Moves one field in a straigt line, if moved another rabble may be moved in the same turn

home.title: Play Cyvasse! A game inspired by Game of Thrones

prim_action.title: Play Online
prim_action.text: Play against someone on your level

sec_action.title: Learn
sec_action.text: Use our tutorials to get started

courses.title: The Board
courses.extract: Learn about the layout of the board
courses.text: In this course youll learn more about the board and what the different elements mean

lessons.title: Overview
lessons.extract: Learn how the different pieces moves!
lessons.text: Most pieces can either move straight or diagonally, sometimes only one step sometimes unitl they hit an obstacle. A few units can skip over certain other units, some may even move off the edge of the board. No Unit can pass through the fort.

lessons.title: Obstacles on the Board
lessons.extract: Learn about the obstacles on the board!
lessons.text: The main obstacles on the board are: Mountains, River(Blue Fields) and the Forts. Most units cant bypass Mointains and will stop on River Fields. No Unit can pass through the Forts.

lessons.title: Board Set-up
lessons.extract: Learn how the creating of a new game works!
lessons.text: When creating a new game you have to set up your site of the board. First youll place your Fort, which will decide where your units can start. And thee Mountains that can block enemy paths. After that you can place up to 12 Units around your fort. Any not yet placed can enter the game later via a deploy.

courses.title: How to move pieces
courses.extract: Learn how the different pieces moves!
courses.text: Information about every pieces move patters (comming soon, only a few available right now.

lessons.title: The King
lessons.text: The king can move one field in any direction. It doesnt have any special abilities, but loosing it reslults in loosing the game.

lessons.title: The Dragon
lessons.text: The Dragon can move in straight and diagonal lines for any amount of fields. It flies over mountains and rivers

courses.title: How to win
courses.extract: Learn how to win a game
courses.text: Find out how you can win the game by either taking the King directly or capturing the opponent fort

lessons.title: Win by Fort Capture
lessons.extract: Learn how the different pieces moves!
lessons.text: If two of your units enter the enemy home squares, you will capture the fort. All not yet deployed units get captured in that moment. Should the King be one of those Units, you'll win

lessons.title: Win by King Capture
lessons.extract: Alternativly you can also capture the King straight on the field. There is no Check State so watch out when you move your King!
lessons.text: Alternativly you can also capture the King straight on the field. There is no Check State so watch out when you move your King!

courses.title: Reserves
courses.text: The Unique Mechanic of this game

lessons.title: How to Deploy Units
lessons.extract: Learn how the different pieces moves!
